Title: OAS approved by consensus a resolution urging the CNE to publish ...
Description: OAS approved by consensus a resolution urging the CNE to publish the minutes of June 28OAS approved by consensus on Friday a resolution demanding that Venezuelan authorities publish -expeditiously- the minutes of the elections held last July 28 in that country. The text was presented on behalf of the United States and on behalf of Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Canada, Chile, Ecuador, Guatemala, Paraguay, the Dominicana Republic, Suriname and Uruguay as co-sponsors.The resolution calls on the National Electoral Council (CNE) to -promptly publish the minutes with the results of the presidential election vote at the level of each polling station- and -respect the fundamental principle of popular sovereignty through an impartial verification of the results that guarantees the transparency, credibility and legitimacy of the electoral process,- in addition to the safeguarding of electoral equipment and material.

Title: 🇩🇴🇻🇪President Abinader at his inauguration: The Maduro regime...
Description: 🇩🇴🇻🇪President Abinader at his inauguration: The Maduro regime -without the proper transparency required by an electoral process and without any documentary support, has led Venezuela to a crisis that leads us to demand the publication of all the minutes and respect for the popular will expressed by the Venezuelan people.-

Title: Foro Penal affirms that only 55 people detained in protests have ...
Description: Foro Penal affirms that only 55 people detained in protests have been releasedThe NGO Foro Penal said on Thursday that of the more than 1,400 people it has been able to confirm have been arrested following the protests against the official result of the presidential elections in which Nicolás Maduro was declared the winner, only 55 people have been released.-There have been very few people released. Of the more than 1,400 people detained, we have only added 55 people who have been released,- explained the president of the Penal Forum, Alfredo Romero, after an activity of advising the families of these detainees, together with the NGO Provea.
